snippet: On Feb. 1, 1960, four black college students, Joseph McNeil, Franklin McCain, David Richmond and Ezell Blair, sat down at a "whites-only" lunch counter n Greensboro, N.C., and refused to leave after being denied service.
abstract: On Feb. 1, 1960, four black college students, Joseph McNeil, Franklin McCain, David Richmond and Ezell Blair, sat down at a "whites-only" lunch counter n Greensboro, N.C., and refused to leave after being denied service.

headline.main: Feb. 1, 1960 | Black Students and the Greensboro Sit-In
